label: Telegram to Congresswoman Shirley Chisholm from Mary Moultrie
description: Telegram to Congresswoman Shirley Chisholm from Mary Moultrie requesting Chisholm to provide assistance and aid in bringing national attention to the workers' problems.

metadata.value: Telegram to Congresswoman Shirley Chisholm from Mary Moultrie requesting Chisholm to provide assistance and aid in bringing national attention to the workers' problems.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
MAR 24 300P
577-3732
BROOKLYN NY

CONGRESSWOMAN SHIRLEY CHISHOLM
1028 ST JOHN PL.

SISTER CHISHOM; UREGENTLY [sic] REQUEST YOUR ATTENTION AND
AID FOR 400 STRIKING BLACK WORKERS AT THE MEDICAL
COLLEGE OF SOUTH CAROLINA IN CHARLESTON.OVER
100 MEMBERS OF LOCAL 1199B NATIONAL ORGANIZING
COMMITTEE OF HOSPITAL AND NURSING HOME WORKERS HAVE
BEEN ARRESTED BY CITY COUNTY AND STATE POLICE SINCE
MARCH 20. LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICALS HAVE DISPLAYED
UNRESTRIIINED INTIMIDATION AND VIOLENCE. ARRESTS
MOUNT DAILY AND SITUATION IS WORSENING. NATIONAL
ATTENTION IS UTMOST NECESSITY TO ALLOW THESE WORKERS
THEIR RIGHT TO UNION REPRESENTATION AND AN END TO
POVERTY WAGES AND DISCRIMINATORY PRACTICES IN THE
HOSPITAL.

MARY MOULTRIE PRES
LOCAL 1199B
NATIONAL ORGANIZING
COMMITTEE OF HOSPITAL 
AND NURSING HOME WORKERS
